intro: Aldina yapacanensis, commonly known as the Yapacanensis Aldina, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
